channel.title: event on Plazi
channel.description: Recent content in event on Plazi

item.title: Oct 18-22, 2021. TDWG 2021 — Virtual Annual Conference
item.description: As we continue to connect people and biodiversity data globally by virtual means in these globally uncertain times, TDWG 2021 will be composed of symposia, workshops, contributed oral and poster presentations, demos, and discussions, as well as keynotes and social events. The Interest/Task Group working sessions will be held separately during the month following the virtual conference (November 2021). TDWG Symposia and TDWG Schedule Oct 20, 8:30 CET SYM18 Discovering known biodiversity: Digital accessible knowledge Session Type: Symposium (no unsolicited presentations considered)

item.title: Oct 21, 2021. 17th Int'l Conference on Digital Preservation, Beijing, China
item.description: October 21, 2021: Beijing, China Plazi together with Data Futures, MNHN France, SIB Switzerland and CERN Switzerland will present the lecture “Progress with improving preservation and reuse of scientific research data. Abstract: We report progress towards automatically transforming existing analyses of scientific literature into annotations based on W3C’s Web Annotation Data Model (WADM). Case studies are presented from the life sciences, and social sciences and humanities, in which these developments have led to the creation of new unrestricted data services for the research community.

item.title: 26 Jun–1 Jul, 2022. 2nd World Biodiversity Forum
item.description: Plazi will present its groundbreaking approach to the “liberation” of data from taxonomic treatments within scholarly publications at the World Biodiversity Forum. Reliable and accessible data is essential for understanding biodiversity, its status, trends and pressures, and thus responding with informed policies and action. The FAIR data management principles to make data Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Re-usable, are increasingly referenced and required by funding agencies and institutions; however, implementation remains deficient at many levels.
